LanguageData.AYCharcoal.label: Charcoal
LanguageData.AYCharcoal.description: Charcoal is a lightweight black carbon residue produced by removing water and other volatile constituents from animal and plant materials. Charcoal is usually produced by slow pyrolysis — the heating of wood or other organic materials in the absence of oxygen. This process is called charcoal burning.
LanguageData.AYWoodAshes.label: Wood Ashes
LanguageData.AYWoodAshes.description: Wood ashes are the residue powder left after the combustion of wood.
LanguageData.AYAmmoniaCharcoal.label: Charcoal (Ammonia Treated)
LanguageData.AYAmmoniaCharcoal.description: Charcoal treated with ammonia to be used as a fuel for evapouration in specialised passive coolers
